intro: Cyathostegia weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's cyathostegia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are often white or pale blue. Cyathostegia weberbaueri is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
